docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship ?? arrived at Boston at 7 o'clock yesterday morning. We obtain some further news of interest from our foregin files. The London Star says: "It is currently removed that there is to be an immediate dissolution of Parliament.

headline.main: MUNICIPAL.; Another Batch of Frauds in the street Department--A ??kable Communication from Stephen H. Branch. THE BOARD OF ALDERMEN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board or Aldermen met last evening President CLANEY in the Chair. The following resolution was adopted: Resolrad, That the pier (No.35) foot of Frankla street, North River, be struek out of the list of wharves and piers to be leased on the 16th instant at auction, as said pier has been apalied for lerry ourposes, and is now under consideration by the Committee on Ferries.

headline.main: Florence Nightingale before the Army Medical Reform Commission. A Royal Commission. presided over by

docs.lead_paragraph: A Royal Commission, presided over by Right Hon. SIDNEY HERBERT, has recently been engaged in investigating the sanitary condition of the British Army, and among the witnesses whose testimony has been deemed necessary to the completeness of the inquiry has been MISS FLORENCE NIGHTINGALE.

docs.lead_paragraph: A few short months since and PALMERSTON was the fancy man of England. Few statesmen had ever been borne to her councils on a prouder or broader swell. His name was as a charm to dispel all misgivings and disarm all doubts. His star has, however, at least for a moment, fallen from its ascendant place. The nation has had its dream and is awakening.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM EUROPE.; YEH TAKEN PRISONER. Occupation of Canton by the Anglo-French Forces. LATER FROM INDIA AND CHINA. Consols 96 7-8a97. Cotton Advanced--Breadstuffs Quiet. ONE WEEK'S LACER NEWS. Trial and Conviction of the French Conspirators. Arrival of the Kangaroo at this port and the Canada at Halifax. Formation of New Government under Lord Derby. Overthrow of the Palmerston Ministry.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival at this port yesterday of the Kangaroo, (from Liverpool on the 24th ult.,) and tile Canada at Halifax, (from Liverpool on tile 27th,) we are placed in possession of one week's later news from Europe. The Canada makes the following report: Passed off Cork, Feb. 28, the British Mail Steamship Arabia, from New-York.
docs.abstract: Mazzini denies him to have been guilty of any crime in Italy

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: The question of he expediency of the Founding Hospital is one that would be answered conversely. by equally pure and philanthropic men. One sees in such an institution, moral degradation of the community, encouragement of licentiousness, and increase of prostitution; he other believes such an institution would arrest the increasing crime of infanticide,

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctor WILLIAM TURNER, who died at his residence in this City on Monday last, after a brief illness, was a native of New-York, and at one time a prominent politician when the Whig Party was in the ascendency. He was a son of the publisher of the old New-York Gazette, once the the lead. ing daily paper of this City, and was for several years connected with it in an editorial capacity.

headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; Arrival of the Cahawba.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States mail steamship Cahawba, J. D. BULLOCK, Commander, from New-Orleans via Havana, arrived at this port yesterday morning. The Cahawba left Havana on the 2d inst. At Havana everything was very dull ; business was quiet. Stock of Sugars 80,000 boxes, with some advance in figures. Shipped last week 2,500 boxes. Freights improved in demand, but not in prices.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the United States Senate, yesterday, the Military Committee were instructed to inquire into the propriety of amending the law to punish the crime of desertion in the Army. Mr. GREEN, from the Committee on Territories, gave notice that he would call for a direct vote on his bill for the admission of Kansas under the Lecompton Constitution on Monday next.
